reviews.review_msg: Mandana is a very unapproachable teacher. She seems like she does not care at all about her students. When you talk with her, she seems like she wants to end the convo as quick as possible. During the final, she went against SFU policy and refused to let me use the washroom. Only good thing about her is that exams are fair.

I don't know why so many people are complaining about her. She makes it clear about what she wants. Take notes from the textbook & study that completely and then print out her lecture notes just to see what you've missed. Got nearly perfect on both the midterms and the final exam... No new information was presented

Read all of the content off the lecture slides and lectures were sometimes too long  and confusing. Mid-terms/ Final are difficult as some questions didn't even correspond to the lectures. Not really approachable and TA isn't the greatest marker either.
The class wasn't hard, per se, but she was definitely unapproachable, cocky and condescending. I don't know, something about her just really ticked me off.
His lectures don't make any sense, there is no main point. All we do is go in circles. And now there's a midterm???

No hate, he seems to be very chill. He likes to ramble, maybe it's subconscious â€”but it would make it a lot easier to pay attention if he were more concise. We often get off track, and I would lose sight of what we were discussing in the first place.

had over 30 readings and the exams (no MCQ) only focused on reading comprehension, not the three hour lectures he spends hardly teaching the readings. attendance isn't counted/no iclicker but you can only find him at lecture because he did not post office hours, TA information, or his email in the syllabus, and if you email him he does not reply.
he makes you read 7+ articles for each chapter and does not teach the articles in class. goes on tangents in class and you basically have to teach yourself and memorize lots or articles to do well

I am so glad I took HSCI180 with Julian this semester. The exams were fair and I did well on all. I didnt fully read the papers we were tested on, and I managed to get high 90s for each exam. Julian was an incredible prof, he brings tons of relevant experience to this course, hes hilarious, approachable and all around an excellent addition to FHS

This class was so full because its drugs and society and sounds interesting, but prof somers found a way to BUTCHER it. more of a researcher than a prof. He would read over slides and it was clear that it was the first time he was seeing this information. Exams were brutal test bank questions from a dense textbook and too specific. Waste of credit
Truly the most terrible professor. He first needs to realize his responsibly as a professor before going out and teaching, not sure how this guy has decades of experience. Never take his course.

By far the worst class I'v ever taken. Exams were extremely difficult and lectures were brutal. It was just way too much information to know for the exams and he did not teach anything in lecture, he just skimmed over slides and basically expected you to learn yourself.

I hated his class. Period. He reads off slides that are not his and is genuinely so lazy. Midterm was hard and unfair. He really likes to go off-topic and by the end of the lecture when he wants to leave he skims through a slide with a lot of information in 2 seconds.

Julian is definitely unprepared in terms of teaching lectures. If you want to do well in this class, get ready to teach yourself through the textbook. He has iClicker quizzes worth 30% at the beginning of class so reading the textbook and coming to class is mandatory! Other than that, he's not the worst prof but he definitely isn't the best.
worst professor ever.
He's a G.

Never prepared, reads off slides from the textbook publishers and when the slide pops up on the projector, he acts like its the first time he's seen them (skims them first to see what it says). How is this guy a prof? Anyone could teach the exact same way he does (read off prewritten slides, making it sound like he's never seen them in his life)

Julian Somers has no responsibility of being a professor at SFU. He's always unprepared and the slides that he posts on canvas are copied and pasted onto his slides!! He also "raps" in class and tries to finish everything so quickly which makes the class BRUTAL. I recommend taking it if you have basic science background especially biology.

Unprepared! When he begins the slides (those of which aren't even his own), it seems like he's never seen them in his entire life even though he's been teaching this class for years. He goes through hundreds of slides a week, goes off topic so many times, and the only reason you should come to class are the iclicker quizzes. Would not recommend.

I hate him hes so unprepared its actually kinda sad. hsci 180 was not an easy course. i hated it so much. if you're not a science person i would not take this course. it is a waste of time and money. not an easy A course for sure. dragging it out for 3 hours makes me wanna kms

Iclicker quizzes easy marks. the midterm and final are noncumulative and MC, as long as you keep up with the readings and skim through before the tests, should be easy. if you read the textbook, alot of the information is common sense. usually lectures end early and a few times, he can be a bit repetitive. better to stay in case of extra iclicker

The class is pretty interesting as it's about drugs, so made memorizing more bearable. 40% of your grade is from iClicker quizzes which are free marks. The rest are from MT/Final, which aren't easy as he tests tiny details from the textbook. Not the easy A everyone says, but all around a decent B-Sci elective if you're ready to do some work.

No homework, iClicker grade contributes to 40% of overall grade, midterm and final are 30% each and all multiple choice questions. Lectures are dry as he has to fill 3 hours, but overall a pretty good professor.

Julian Somers, lectures were boring but when it came to the exams, they're pretty straight forward. Just show up to class, do the iclicker quiz, read the textbook and you'll honestly at least get a 80.

Attend lecture because of the iclicker quizzes (usually 2 chapters per lecture so 2 quizzes per class). Necessary do the reading before lecture, or else will do poorly on quizzes; He doesn't make us put away notes and laptops but with only 30 secs per question, there isn't much time to think. Exams are the same format as the quizzes, mc.

This was a solid class, straight from the text. Iclicker questions are easy marks. He didnt give breaks but almost always finished early. I thought he was fair and helpful. If you read the text youll do well.

Relatively easy class but the most BORING lectures ever. He literally read off the slides, which were prepared by another institution, and went on so many tangents that weren't relevant to the exams. He gave us contradictory information and didn't seem to know the course content at all. Interesting material though. Can find practice quizzes online.

Overall not a tough course. But the professor is pretty much useless although he is nice and informant. Notes aren't his own, tests questions aren't hand picked by him and neither are iclicker questions. Everything is out of the textbook.

ok first of all, he's pretty attractive for a middle-age man. Anyways his lectures were super engaging always try to ask for student's opinions, and learn from each other. He cracks jokes often and he uses his body language to really show what he's trying to teach. Great prof! so lucky iclicker quizzes are worth 40% lol...

Very passionate professor. He knows his material very well. However, his lectures are pointless with the exception of iclicker quizzes. HSCI 180 is fairly easy if you keep up with the readings in the book, his midterm and final are based on textbook.
Great Prof, who cares about his students. I would recommend this course! Keep up with the readings you will ace the course.++++++++++++++
Ok class. He is passionate about the material, but lectures are boring; they are 3 hours long but often end a bit early. He tends to ramble on during lectures but his tests and quizzes are fair.

super BORING class, lectures are so dull but mandatory since his iclicker quizzes are worth 40% of your grade - quizzes are easy but midterms are kind of tough for some reason he likes to put in stats like how many people died of cocaine abuse in 1997 :/ i do not recommend this class

Professor Somers was easily my favourite prof. He made lectures somewhat enjoyable, though dry at times. Uses "um" a lot but nonetheless he was extremely fair, tests were 120 MC worth 40% each &weekly quizzes on readings @ 20%. SUPER nice and pretty funny at times. Majority of the lectures ended 30 mins early. HIGHLY RECOMMEND TAKING THIS COURSE!

Dr. Somers is a great prof!! Easy to follow along and its a very chill, student first environment! He will do anything he can to have you succeed! Recommend for a science minded first year student. (That being said it is relatively easy either way)
super nice prof, super boring class. exams are fair/easy.
barely went to the 3 hr lecture, but material was interesting. studied from the textbook and got a B.

Class was boring, but I think that had more to do with the class material than the prof. Tests are decent, just study off the slides as the textbook wasn't really used. Julian is a nice prof though and always encourages questions without making you feel stupid.

Professor Somers made this class extraordinarily enjoyable. I haven't enjoyed a class at SFU nearly as much as this one, and I'm a poli sci major for that matter. He's a bit disorganized and sort of rambles at times, but as someone said, if you just try to enjoy the material as much as he does you will learn a plethora of useful information.
print out all the lecture notes to study from.

learned about different types of drugs. he was thoughtful and seemed to really enjoy teaching but he can go on and on about stuff. used iclickers for marks in every class except midterm days and days we handed in essays.
